w:r.w:t: Keep UI consistent with your current Dashboard → Grammar DB Update → “Assess by Word”.
Reuse the existing “Assess by Verse” analysis window to perform verse-level tagging; “Assess by Word” is an orchestration layer that feeds it a curated queue of verses for the chosen word(s).
Lean on your existing normalization helpers (e.g., NFC + danda stripping) when matching tokens so results don’t drift due to invisible glyphs.

return [w.strip().lower() for w in re.split(r"\s+", s) if w.strip()]
Implementation will proceed in a sequential, task-by-task manner using Codex CLI. At each stage:
odex will focus on a single defined task from this plan.
The implementation for that task will be carried out and validated.
Codex will then push the branch with the changes.
Codex will draft a clear PR description summarizing the changes made, assumptions (if any), and the checks performed.
fter review and refinement, the next task in sequence will be initiated.
This loop ensures that development stays incremental, reviewable, and tightly aligned with the plan while leveraging Codex CLI for version control and documentation.
The sequence of tasks to be carried out, one at a time, is as follows:
Create launch_word_assessment_dashboard() with three buttons wired (no logic yet).
Implement tracker helpers (create, load, append) using openpyxl via pandas.
Build the lexicon index from 1.1.3 …xlsx and the word-search modal.
Implement verse-hit list with checkbox selection UI and write entries to Progress.
Add the driver that opens the Verse analyzer and updates Progress/Words.
Wire the “Continue” and “Completed” views with their filters and actions.
